output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of control systems, equipping you with the knowledge to analyze and design basic control loops. Further study and practical experience are recommended to deepen your expertise.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of Control Systems! This course will guide you through the fundamental concepts, providing a beginner-friendly introduction to the principles and applications of control engineering.

chapters.description: Definition of a control system, open-loop vs. closed-loop systems, examples in everyday life.

chapters.chapterTitle: Basic Components of a Control System
chapters.description: Sensors, actuators, controllers, and the plant. Understanding their roles and interactions.
Introduction to transfer functions as a mathematical representation of a system's input-output relationship.
Using block diagrams to visualize and simplify complex control systems.
Comparing the behavior of open-loop and closed-loop systems to different inputs.
Understanding terms like rise time, settling time, and overshoot.
Defining stability in control systems and its importance.
Brief overview of methods for determining system stability (e.g., Routh-Hurwitz criterion).
Understanding the basics of proportional control and its effect on system response.
Introduction to integral control and its role in eliminating steady-state error.
Combining P, I, and D control actions for improved performance.
Brief introduction to methods for tuning PID controllers (e.g., trial and error).
